rules.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 Colour continuous-tone picture
rules.description:
There are three formats for describing the pixel structure of colour continuous-tone picture file data: pixel interleaving (also called chunky format). line interleaving (also called row interleaving). colour interleaving (also called planar format).
TIFF/IT-CT/P1 is a simplified image file format profile for colour continuous-tone picture image (CT) data and can be considered a constrained subset of TIFF/IT-CT. TIFF/IT-CT/P1 files can be read by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers that conform to TIFF 6.0, Section 16: CMYK Images.
TIFF/IT-CT/P1 does not permit any compression of image data.
NOTE TIFF/IT-CT/P1 do not allow the use of a value 32895 for field 259 (Compression) to indicate the use of raster padding nor do they allow the use of field 34019 (RasterPadding).

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 BitsPerSample valid values
rule.description: BitsPerSample on a colour continuous-tone picture (CT) file must be 8,8,8,8

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample should be [8,8,8,8]

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 Compression valid value
rule.description: The only valid value for Compression is 1, No compression.

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression value for colour continuous-tone picture (CT) image. The only valid value is no compression (1)

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 PhotometricInterpretation valid value
rule.description: The only valid value for PhotometricInterpretation in continuous-tone picture (CT) is CMYK

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression value for colour continuous-tone picture (CT) image

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 SamplesPerPixel valid value
rule.description: The only valid value for SamplesPerPixel in continuous-tone picture (CT) is 4

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid SamplesPerPixel. SamplesPerPixel for colour continuous-tone picture (CT) CMYK should be 4

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 PlanarConfiguration valid value
rule.description: PlanarConfiguration on a colour continuous-tone picture (CT) file must be 1

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid PlanarConfiguration. PlanarConfiguration for colour continuous-tone picture (CT) CMYK should be 1

rule.title: TIFF/IT-CT/P1 InkSet valid value
rule.description: InkSet on a colour continuous-tone picture (CT) file must be 1

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: Invalid InkSet. InkSet for colour continuous-tone picture (CT) CMYK should be 1

rule.description: InkNames is forbidden on a colour continuous-tone picture (CT)

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: InkNames is forbidden on a colour continuous-tone picture (CT)

rule.description: If NumberOfInks tag is used, it must be 4

reference.section: Section 7.3.3: TIFF/IT-CT encoding

rule.assert: invalid NumberOfInks. If NumberOfInks tag is used, it must be 4

rule.description: If NumberOfInks tag is used, it must have the same value as the value of SamplesPerPixel

rules.title: Colour line-art (LW) file
rules.description:
Colour line-art data consists of an image file comprised of the following three parts.The first part consists of one or more blocks of run-length encoded data describing the colour line-art image in terms of colour numbers and run lengths.The second part is a colour table (in the IFD) that defines the colour values for the colour numbers of the first part.The third part is a table describing the separations of the second part.This data structure is similar to binary line-art data with the addition of two colour tables for colour specification.
TIFF/IT-LW/P1 is a simplified image-file format profile for line-art (LW) image data and can be considered a constrained subset of TIFF/IT-LW specified for simpler implementation.
NOTE TIFF/IT-LW files are not readable by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and cannot be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers because of the mandatory use of TIFF/IT-specific fields and values and non-traditional interpretations of other TIFF 6.0 fields and values (e.g. compression by mandatory run length encoding).

rule.title: TIFF/IT-LW/P1 BitsPerSample valid value
rule.description: BitsPerSample valid value on a Colour line-art picture (LW) file must be 8

reference.section: Section 7.4.3: TIFF/IT-LW, TIFF/IT-LW/P1 and TIFF/IT-LW/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample on a Colour line-art picture (LW) file must be 8

rule.title: TIFF/IT-LW/P1 Compression valid value
rule.description: Compression value on a Colour line-art picture (LW) picture must be IT8 Linework RLE (32896)

reference.section: Section 7.4.3: TIFF/IT-LW, TIFF/IT-LW/P1 and TIFF/IT-LW/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression value, Compression should be IT8 Linework RLE (32896)

rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation value on a Colour line-art picture (LW) picture must be CMYK (5)

reference.section: Section 7.4.3: TIFF/IT-LW, TIFF/IT-LW/P1 and TIFF/IT-LW/P2 encoding

rule.description: SamplesPerPixel value on a Colour line-art picture (LW) picture must be 1

rule.assert: Invalid SamplesPerPixel value, SamplesPerPixel should be 1

rule.description: InkSet value on a Colour line-art picture (LW) picture must be 1

rules.title: High-resolution continuous-tone (HC) file
rules.description:
High-resolution continuous-tone data consist of an image file of one or more blocks of run-length encoded pixel data. The number of lines is defined in the ImageLength field. Each line is made up of pixel runs and starts and ends with a blank pixel run (all zero bytes). Each pixel run is made up of two components: a run length followed by a colour value. The run length is a 16-bit integer as defined in 7.4.2.4.2. The big-endian byte order is used regardless of the order used in the TIFF/IT directories (IFD). The sum of the run lengths in the line shall be the value found in ImageWidth. Run lengths shall not cross line boundaries. The colour value is defined by the values of SamplesPerPixel, BitsPerSample, ColorSequence and DotRange in the same manner that CT colour values are specified, except that a special case of colour value is reserved for a transparent colour, if used.
TIFF/IT field 34028 is used as the transparency indicator. If transparency is used, colour values of zero become a special case, and signify transparency in that separation of the high-resolution continuous-tone (HC) data. Transparency indicates that the underlying colour picture separation value is used.
TIFF/IT-HC/P1 is a simplified image file format profile for high-resolution continuous-tone (HC) image data and can be considered a constrained subset of TIFF/IT-HC specifically intended for simpler implementation.
NOTE TIFF/IT-HC/P1 is not readable by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and cannot be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers because of the mandatory use of TIFF/IT-specific fields and values and nontraditional interpretations of other TIFF 6.0 fields and values (e.g. compression by mandatory run-length encoding).

rule.title: TIFF/IT-HC/P1 BitsPerSample valid values
rule.description: BitsPerSample on a High-resolution continuous-tone data (HC) file must be [8,8,8,8]

reference.section: Section 7.5.3: TIFF/IT-HC, TIFF/IT-HC/P1 and TIFF/IT-HC/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample should be [8,8,8,8]

rule.title: TIFF/IT-HC/P1 Compression valid value
rule.description: Compression valid values for High-resolution continuous-tone data (HC) is IT8MP Run-length encoding, used with HC format (32897)

reference.section: Section 7.5.3: TIFF/IT-HC, TIFF/IT-HC/P1 and TIFF/IT-HC/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression. Compression for High-resolution continuous-tone data should be IT8MP Run-length encoding (32897)

rule.title: TIFF/IT-HC/P1 PhotometricInterpretation valid value
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation valid value for High-resolution continuous-tone data (HC) is CMYK (5)

reference.section: Section 7.5.3: TIFF/IT-HC, TIFF/IT-HC/P1 and TIFF/IT-HC/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid PhotometricInterpretation value, PhotometricInterpretation should be CMYK (5)

rule.description: PlanarConfiguration for a High-resolution continuous-tone data (HC) must be 1

rules.title: Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) file
rules.description:
The image-colour values for a pixel are obtained by combining the colour values for each of the colour components with the pixel-intensity values in the data stream. This applies to foreground colours only. Monochrome continuous-tone pictures do not have background-colour specifications.The scaling of these intensity values is linear with respect to printing-dot percent.
TIFF/IT-MP/P1 is a simplified image file format profile for monochrome continuous-tone picture image (MP) data and can be considered a constrained subset of TIFF/IT-MP specifically intended for simpler implementation.
TIFF/IT-MP/P1 does not permit any compression of image data.
NOTE TIFF/IT-MP/P1 files can be read by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers. TIFF/IT-MP/P1 files will be recognized by baseline TIFF 6.0 readers as Grayscale images as described in Section 4 of the TIFF 6.0 specification. As such, all reference to colour specifications will be lost, since those fields describing colour are not recognized by a baseline TIFF 6.0 reader.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-MP/P1 BitsPerSample valid values
rule.description: BitsPerSample on a Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) file must be 8

reference.section: Section 7.6.3: TIFF/IT-MP, TIFF/IT-MP/P1 and TIFF/IT-MP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample should be 8

rule.title: TIFF/IT-MP/P1 Compression valid values
rule.description: Compression valid value for Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) file is: 1 = No compression

reference.section: Section 7.6.3: TIFF/IT-MP, TIFF/IT-MP/P1 and TIFF/IT-MP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression for Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) file

rule.title: TIFF/IT-MP/P1 PhotometricInterpretation valid values
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation valid value for Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) is WhiteIsZero (0)

rule.assert: Invalid PhotometricInterpretation value, PhotometricInterpretation should be WhiteIsZero (0)

reference.section: Section 7.6.3: TIFF/IT-MP, TIFF/IT-MP/P1 and TIFF/IT-MP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: CMYKEquivalent for a Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rule.title: TIFF/IT-MP/P1 ICCProfile is forbidden
rule.description: ICCProfile for Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.6.3: TIFF/IT-MP, TIFF/IT-MP/P1 and TIFF/IT-MP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: ICCProfile for a Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rule.title: TIFF/IT-MP/P1 ImageColorIndicator valid values

reference.section: Section 7.6.3: TIFF/IT-MP, TIFF/IT-MP/P1 and TIFF/IT-MP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid ImageColorIndicator value. ImageColorIndicator in Monochrome continuous-tone picture (MP) file should be 0 or 1.

rules.title: Binary picture (BP) file
rules.description:
For binary pictures, ImageColorValue and BackgroundColorValue may contain the values of the colour components for the image (foreground) and background colour, specified in the sequence as defined in ColorSequence. These colour values apply to the solid image and background colours for binary pictures. The data stream indicates which of the colours, foreground and background, will print. The bits in the data stream function as a switch between the image colour and the background colour. Bitmap fill order is from most significant bit to least significant bit within the byte, the default TIFF fill order. ImageColorIndicator and BackgroundColorIndicator field values shall be used to indicate when, if, and how image and background colours are used, including the use of transparency.
TIFF/IT-BP/P1 limit the field values to the default value, a single value or a small choice of values. TIFF/IT-BP/P1 also limit the usage of optional fields to the minimum required for reasonable interchange.
NOTE TIFF/IT-BP/P1 is a simplified image file format profile for binary picture (BP) image data and can be considered a constrained subset of TIFF/IT-BP specifically intended for simpler implementation. TIFF/IT-BP/P1 files can be read by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers. TIFF/IT-BP/P1 files will be recognized by baseline TIFF 6.0 readers as Bilevel Images as described by Section 3 of the TIFF 6.0 specification. As such, all reference to colour specifications will be lost since those fields describing colour are not recognized by a baseline TIFF 6.0 reader.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 BitsPerSample valid values
rule.description: BitsPerSample on a Binary picture (BP) file must be 1

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample should be 1

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 Compression valid values
rule.description: Compression valid values for Binary picture (BP) file is: 1 = No compression

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression for Binary picture (BP) file

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 PhotometricInterpretation valid value
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation valid value for Binary picture (BP) is WhiteIsZero

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid PhotometricInterpretation value, PhotometricInterpretation should be WhiteIsZero (0)

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 SamplesPerPixel valid value
rule.description: SamplesPerPixel for Binary picture (BP) should be 1

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid SamplesPerPixel. SamplesPerPixel for Binary picture (BP) should be 1

rule.description: InkSet for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: InkSet for a Binary picture (BP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rule.description: InkNames for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

rule.description: NumberOfInks for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 DotRange valid value
rule.description: If DotRange tag is used forBinary picture (BP) TIFF/IT P1 file, it must be 0,255

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid DotRange. If DotRange tag is used, it must be 0,255

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 ColorSequence is forbidden
rule.description: ColorSequence for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: ColorSequence for a Binary picture (BP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 ImageColorValue mandatory
rule.description: In a Binary picture (BP) file If ImageColorIndicator value is 1, ImageColorValue is mandatory.

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: ImageColorValue is mandatory. If ImageColorIndicator is 1 in Binary picture (BP) file.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 ImageColorValue forbidden
rule.description: In a Binary picture (BP) file If ImageColorIndicator value is 0, ImageColorValue is forbidden.

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: ImageColorValue is forbidden if ImageColorIndicator is 0 in Binary picture (BP) file.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 BackgroundColorValue mandatory
rule.description: In a Binary picture (BP) file If BackgroundColorIndicator value is 1, BackgroundColorValue is mandatory.

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: BackgroundColorValue is mandatory. If BackgroundColorIndicator is 1 in Binary picture (BP) file.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 BackgroundColorValue forbidden
rule.description: In a Binary picture (BP) file If BackgroundColorIndicator value is 0, BackgroundColorValue is forbidden.

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: BackgroundColorValue is forbidden if BackgroundColorIndicator is 0 in Binary picture (BP) file.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 TrapIndicator is forbidden
rule.description: TrapIndicator for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: TrapIndicator for a Binary picture (BP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BP/P1 CMYKEquivalent is forbidden
rule.description: CMYKEquivalent for Binary picture (BP) P1 is forbidden

reference.section: Section 7.7.3: TIFF/IT-BP, TIFF/IT-BP/P1 and TIFF/IT-BP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: CMYKEquivalent for a Binary picture (BP) TIFF/IT P1 file is forbidden

rules.title: Binary line-art (BL) file
rules.description:
Each line of data shall be encoded as a sequence of pairs of background and image run lengths. Each new scan line shall start with a background run. In the case where a continuous background or an image section of a scan line has to be encoded by more than one run length pair, a zero run-length of the “opposite” colour shall be inserted. For binary line-art, the data stream indicates which of the colours, foreground or background, will print. The decoded run lengths of the data stream function as a switch between the image (foreground) colour and the background colour.
TIFF/IT-BL/P1 limits the field values to the default value, a single value or a small choice of values. TIFF/IT-BL/P1 also limits the usage of optional fields to the minimum required for reasonable interchange.
NOTE TIFF/IT-BL/P1 files are not readable by typical TIFF 6.0 readers and neither can be written by typical TIFF 6.0 writers because of the mandatory use of TIFF/IT-specific fields and values, and non-traditional interpretations of other TIFF 6.0 fields and values (e.g., compression by mandatory run length encoding). It is possible to write filters for DTP applications that need to read and write TIFF/IT-BL/P1 files.The filters for TIFF/IT-BL/P1, as it is a simplified profile, are easier to implement than for TIFF/IT-BL.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BL/P1 BitsPerSample valid values
rule.description: BitsPerSample on a Binary line-art (BL) file must be 1

reference.section: Section 7.8.3: TIFF/IT-BL and TIFF/IT-BL/P1 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid BitsPerSample value. BitsPerSample should be 1

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BL/P1 Compression valid values
rule.description: Compression valid value on a Binary line-art (BL) is: 32895 = IT8CTPAD

reference.section: Section 7.8.3: TIFF/IT-BL and TIFF/IT-BL/P1 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid Compression on a Binary line-art (BL) file. compression should be IT8CTPAD

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BL/P1 PhotometricInterpretation valid values
rule.description: PhotometricInterpretation valid value on a Binary line-art (BL) es WhiteIsZero (0)

reference.section: Section 7.8.3: TIFF/IT-BL and TIFF/IT-BL/P1 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid PhotometricInterpretation value, PhotometricInterpretation should be WhiteIsZero (0)

rule.title: TIFF/IT-BL/P1 SamplesPerPixel valid value
rule.description: SamplesPerPixel on a Binary line-art (BL) should be 1

reference.section: Section 7.8.3: TIFF/IT-BL and TIFF/IT-BL/P1 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid SamplesPerPixel. SamplesPerPixel on a Binary line-art (BL) should be 1

rules.title: Final page (FP) file
rules.description:
Typically, a final page, ready for exposure on an output recorder, consists of more than one of the CT, MP, SD, LW, BL, BP and HC raster formats described in this International Standard. TIFF/IT-FP provides a mechanism for associating image files of the different types that make up a final page.
By default, it is assumed that, for each image type, the page assembly processes have combined all the pageinput components of that data type into one output file: the single-component image file of that data type for the page, though this is a requirement only for both TIFF/IT-P1 and TIFF/IT-P2 conformance.
The component-image files of a final page may be of any one of the TIFF/IT, TIFF/IT-P1, or TIFF/IT-P2 conformance levels. The final page is considered to be TIFF/IT-P1-conformant only if all of its component files are TIFF/IT-P1-conformant and its own fields are TIFF/IT-FP/P1-conformant as specified in 7.10.2.5. The final page is considered to be TIFF/IT-P2-conformant only if all of its component files are TIFF/IT-P1- or TIFF/IT-P2-conformant and its own fields are TIFF/IT-FP/P2-conformant as specified in 7.10.2.5.

rule.title: TIFF/IT-FP/P1 NewSubfileType valid value
rule.description: NewSubfileType on Final page (FP) file should be bigger than 7

reference.section: Section 7.10.3: TIFF/IT-FP, TIFF/IT-FP and TIFF/IT-FP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid NewSubfileType. NewSubfileType value on Final page (FP) file should be bigger than 7

rule.title: TIFF/IT-FP/P1 ImageWidth valid value
rule.description: ImageWidth on Final page (FP) file must be any value such that ImageWidth divided by XResolution equals the exact actual page width in ResolutionUnits.

reference.section: Section 7.10.3: TIFF/IT-FP, TIFF/IT-FP and TIFF/IT-FP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid ImageWidth. ImageWidth value on Final page (FP)must be any value such that ImageWidth divided by XResolution equals the exact actual page width in ResolutionUnits

rule.title: TIFF/IT-FP/P1 ImageLength valid value
rule.description: ImageLength on Final page (FP) file must be any value such that ImageWidth divided by YResolution equals the exact actual page width in ResolutionUnits.

reference.section: Section 7.10.3: TIFF/IT-FP, TIFF/IT-FP and TIFF/IT-FP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid ImageLength. ImageLength value on Final page (FP)must be any value such that ImageLength divided by YResolution equals the exact actual page width in ResolutionUnits

rule.title: TIFF/IT-FP/P1 ImageDescription mandatory
rule.description: ImageDescription on Final page (FP) file is mandatory and must contain the name of the FP file at creation time, in order to facilitate identifying it in case of a subsequent rename.

reference.section: Section 7.10.3: TIFF/IT-FP, TIFF/IT-FP and TIFF/IT-FP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: ImageDescription on Final page (FP) file is mandatory and must contain the name of the FP file at creation time, in order to facilitate identifying it in case of a subsequent rename

rule.title: TIFF/IT-FP/P1 PlanarConfiguration valid value
rule.description: PlanarConfiguration on Final page (FP) file must be chunky (1).

reference.section: Section 7.10.3: TIFF/IT-FP, TIFF/IT-FP and TIFF/IT-FP/P2 encoding

rule.assert: Invalid PlanarConfiguration. PlanarConfiguration on Final page (FP) file should be chunky (1)
